get.description: Streams 100% of compliance data for Posts

parameters.name: backfill_minutes
parameters.description: The number of minutes of backfill requested

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: The partition number

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The earliest UTC timestamp from which the Post Compliance events will be provided

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The latest UTC timestamp to which the Post Compliance events will be provided

get.description: Returns Post Counts that match a search query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: One query/rule/filter for matching Posts. Refer to https://t.co/rulelength to identify the max query length

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The oldest UTC timestamp (from most recent 7 days) from which the Posts will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is inclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 includes the first second of the minute)

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The newest, most recent UTC timestamp to which the Posts will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is exclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 excludes the first second of the minute)

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Post ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID

parameters.name: until_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Post ID less than (that is, older than) the specified ID

parameters.name: next_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity for the search counts results

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: One query/rule/filter for matching Posts. Refer to https://t.co/rulelength to identify the max query length

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The oldest UTC timestamp (from most recent 7 days) from which the Posts will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is inclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 includes the first second of the minute)

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The newest, most recent UTC timestamp to which the Posts will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is exclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 excludes the first second of the minute)

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Post ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID

parameters.name: until_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Post ID less than (that is, older than) the specified ID

parameters.name: next_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity for the search counts results

get.description: Returns rules from a User's active rule set. Users can fetch all of their rules or a subset, specified by the provided rule ids.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Rule IDs

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This value is populated by passing the 'next_token' returned in a request to paginate through results

post.description: Add or delete rules from a User's active rule set. Users can provide unique, optionally tagged rules to add. Users can delete their entire rule set or a subset specified by rule ids or values.

parameters.name: dry_run
parameters.description: Dry Run can be used with both the add and delete action, with the expected result given, but without actually taking any action in the system (meaning the end state will always be as it was when the request was submitted). This is particularly useful to validate rule changes

parameters.name: delete_all
parameters.description: Delete All can be used to delete all of the rules associated this client app, it should be specified with no other parameters. Once deleted, rules cannot be recovered

get.summary: User mention timeline by User ID
get.description: Returns Post objects that mention username associated to the provided User ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the User to lookup

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: The minimum Post ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over start_time if both are specified

parameters.name: until_id
parameters.description: The maximum Post ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over end_time if both are specified

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The earliest UTC timestamp from which the Posts will be provided. The since_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The latest UTC timestamp to which the Posts will be provided. The until_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified

post.description: Causes the User (in the path) to mute the target User. The User (in the path) must match the User context authorizing the request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that is requesting to mute the target User

get.description: Get a User's Owned Lists.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the User to lookup

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get a specified 'page' of results

get.description: Get a User's Pinned Lists.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User for whom to return results

post.description: Causes a User to pin a List.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that will pin the List

delete.description: Causes a User to remove a pinned List.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User for whom to return results

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The ID of the List to unpin

post.summary: Causes the User (in the path) to repost the specified Post.
post.description: Causes the User (in the path) to repost the specified Post. The User in the path must match the User context authorizing the request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that is requesting to repost the Post

delete.summary: Causes the User (in the path) to unretweet the specified Post
delete.description: Causes the User (in the path) to unretweet the specified Post. The User must match the User context authorizing the request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that is requesting to repost the Post

parameters.name: sourceTweetId
parameters.description: The ID of the Post that the User is requesting to unretweet

get.summary: User home timeline by User ID
get.description: Returns Post objects that appears in the provided User ID's home timeline

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User to list Reverse Chronological Timeline Posts of

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: The minimum Post ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over start_time if both are specified

parameters.name: until_id
parameters.description: The maximum Post ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over end_time if both are specified

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: The set of entities to exclude (e.g. 'replies' or 'retweets')

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The earliest UTC timestamp from which the Posts will be provided. The since_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The latest UTC timestamp to which the Posts will be provided. The until_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified

get.summary: User Posts timeline by User ID
get.description: Returns a list of Posts authored by the provided User ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the User to lookup

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: The minimum Post ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over start_time if both are specified

parameters.name: until_id
parameters.description: The maximum Post ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over end_time if both are specified

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: The set of entities to exclude (e.g. 'replies' or 'retweets')

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The earliest UTC timestamp from which the Posts will be provided. The since_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The latest UTC timestamp to which the Posts will be provided. The until_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified

delete.description: Causes the source User to unfollow the target User. The source User must match the User context authorizing the request

parameters.name: sourceUserId
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that is requesting to unfollow the target User

parameters.name: targetUserId
parameters.description: The ID of the User that the source User is requesting to unfollow

delete.description: Causes the source User to unmute the target User. The source User must match the User context authorizing the request

parameters.name: sourceUserId
parameters.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that is requesting to unmute the target User

parameters.name: targetUserId
parameters.description: The ID of the User that the source User is requesting to unmute

host_ids.description: The user ids for the hosts of the Space

state.description: The current state of the Space

scopes.bookmark.read: Allows an app to read bookmarked Tweets
scopes.bookmark.write: Allows an app to create and delete bookmarks
scopes.dm.write: Send and manage Direct Messages for you
scopes.follows.read: People who follow you and people who you follow.
scopes.follows.write: Follow and unfollow people for you.
scopes.like.read: Tweets youve liked and likes you can view.
scopes.like.write: Like and un-like Tweets for you.
scopes.list.read: Lists, list members, and list followers of lists youve created or are a member of, including private lists.
scopes.list.write: Create and manage Lists for you.
scopes.mute.write: Mute and unmute accounts for you.
scopes.space.read: Access all of the Spaces you can see.
scopes.tweet.moderate.write: Hide and unhide replies to your Tweets.
scopes.tweet.read: All the Tweets you can see, including Tweets from protected accounts.
scopes.users.read: Any account you can see, including protected accounts. Any account you can see, including protected accounts.
